Question: There's so much adventure out there I should discover!!
Option 1: I know, and so little time!!

Question: If I quit my job, I'll have a year of runway before I need to seriously look for work again. In that time? Travel. Explore. I know I’m lucky.
Option 1: If you have this opportunity in life, take it!
Response 1: Next, I need to figure out where to go!

Question: I should move to New York. It's now or never!!! That's what they tell me...
Option 1: It'll only get harder to do so! Do it now!
Response 1: That’s ALSO what they tell me!
Response 2: How will I ever really know </3

Question: Why do I want to move to New York? I mean, everyone's doing it. If I have the opportunity to move, shouldn't I take it just because I can?
Option 2: Are you doing this for the right reasons?

Question: Some people ask me: am I running away from something? Where does the urge to move or travel come from? To that, I say: I have no idea. All I know is that I feel antsy.
Option 1: I like that you're listening to your heart.
Option 2: You'll never find inner peace this way.

Question: Are you worried about us being travel partners?
Option 1: No. We have so much to experience together!!
Option 2: Yes. What will we even do?
Response 2: I was hoping you’d figure out that part.

Question: Thoughts on moving to Paris? Maybe it's too comfortable for me to move somewhere and not learn a new language. No point in moving if that's the case. Right?
Do you think I should buy a boat?
Response 1: First things first, I know nothing about boats. Second, I get horribly seasick. Third...
Response 2: You mean WHERE on earth. That’s because I have no idea where I would store this boat.

Question: What if I move and then never leave the house? What's the point then?
Response 1: It’s a life experience for sure!
Option 2: Exactly. Why change things up just to remain the same person?
Response 2: Wherever I am, there I am...

Question: It's so annoying having to apply for travel visas.
Option 1: I get that. But it will be worth it! You can do it!
Response 1: Maybe you can do mine at the same time you do yours!
Option 2: If you're already worried about an inconvenience like that, you should really reconsider your year of travel.

Question: I'm scared of losing what I have. What if I leave it all behind and I hate what I find?
Option 1: You'll be more okay than you think <3
Response 1: I don't know...I hope so, though.
Option 2: That would be terrible and you'd have to accept that it was all your own doing!
